entries.title: Generational guitarist Jeff Beck dies at 78
entries.description: The eight-time Grammy Award winning artist who rose to rock and roll stardom with 1960s supergroup the Yardbirds passed away on Tuesday at 78 years old.

entries.title: Tatjana Patitz, supermodel of '80s and '90s, dies at 56
entries.description: The favorite of fashion photographer Peter Lindbergh and one of the stars of George Michael's 'Freedom!' music video died at the age of 56.

entries.title: Police begin clearing German village condemned for coal mine
entries.description: Environmentalists say bulldozing the Luetzerath village to expand the nearby Garzweiler coal mine would result in huge amounts of greenhouse gas emissions. The government argue the coal is needed to ensure Germany’s energy security.

entries.title: The French secret service and its 'war chest' caught in the nets of the justice system
entries.description: The French foreign intelligence service unwisely invested its hidden funds in shaky companies over the past few decades. The spy novel-like scandal, of which 'Le Monde' has revealed unpublished elements, led to the indictment of the former head DGSE.

entries.title: In the Himalayas, a town of 20,000 inhabitants is in danger of collapsing
entries.description: The city of Joshimath, in India, is a victim of the road and water works commissioned by Narendra Modi for the widespread development of religious tourism in the region.

entries.title: UK Conservatives suspend lawmaker for vaccine misinformation
entries.description: Andrew Bridgen was suspended from the Conservative party in the House of Commons after tweeting an article questioning the safety of vaccines.

entries.title: Ukraine says mining town Soledar holding out against Russian assault
entries.description: Soledar's fall, while unlikely to provide a turning point in the war, would be a prize for a Kremlin starved of good news from the battlefield in recent months.

entries.title: Pension reform: Right-wing Les Républicains find their 'bittersweet revenge'
entries.description: Right-wing MPs have weighed in on the text and obtained modifications from the government. But this influence will not necessarily be credited to them, especially as their elected representatives remain divided on the subject.

entries.title: British PM Sunak to visit France for first summit in 4 years
entries.description: 'It will be the first meeting of its kind since 2018,' said the French presidency in a statement. The two countries have enjoyed warmer ties since Mr. Sunak took the helm from his predecessors Boris Johnson and Liz Truss.

entries.title: World Handball Championship: France aims for the title and revenge
entries.description: Fourth in the last Euro and World Cup, the reigning Olympic champions face Poland on Wednesday in the opening round of the 2023 World Handball Championship, from January 11 to 29.

entries.title: Ligue 1: Patrick Kisnorbo, the Australian developing Manchester City's project in Troyes
entries.description: Patrick Kisnorbo, the first Australian manager in one of Europe's top five leagues, is trying to implement the attacking style of play carried by the City Football Group.

entries.title: Benin opposition returns to parliament with 28 seats
entries.description: Opposition partis were running for election after years of absence from the country's parliament.

entries.title: French MP convicted for domestic abuse returns to Assemblée Nationale as independent
entries.description: Adrien Quatennens was suspended for four months by his party, La France Insoumise, but he sat Wednesday in the Foreign Affairs Committee.

entries.title: French football boss Le Graët forced to step down
entries.description: The scandal-hit president lost support of the FFF executive committee. The director general, Florence Hardouin, was also suspended from her role.

entries.title: Andrej Babis makes timely visit to Elysée Palace days before Czech presidential election
entries.description: Emmanuel Macron met the presidential candidate on Tuesday just days before a closely contested election.

entries.title: Horsemeat traffickers get prison terms in French trial
entries.description: Fifteen people werre tried for violating EU rules on horsemeat trade and forging official documents between 2010 and 2015.

entries.title: Fine particle pollution in South Korea reaches record levels
entries.description: The government has implemented a battery of measures to reduce locally generated pollution, as well as the pollution imported from neighboring China.

entries.title: Adolfo Kaminsky, French Resistance fighter and photographer, has died
entries.description: The 'Paris Forger,' who helped save thousands of Jews from deportation by forging identity papers, died on Monday in Paris at the age of 97.

entries.title: Attempted insurrection in Brazil: Military police accused of collusion with coup plotters
entries.description: With more than 10,000 men, the Military Police was perfectly aware of the risks. However, this organization, loyal to Jair Bolsonaro, did nothing to prevent the invasion of Brasilia’s institutions.

entries.title: Suicide blast near Afghan ministry, more than 20 casualties
entries.description: More than 20 people were injured after a suicide bomber detonated a device in central Kabul on Wednesday.

entries.title: US domestic flights grounded after system outage
entries.description: The Federal Aviation Administration ordered all domestic US flights to delay departures after a system outage. Airlines and airports were left scrambling with news of the nationwide pause.

entries.title: Russia to send rocket to rescue crew from ISS after leak
entries.description: The leak stemmed from a tiny puncture in the external radiator of the Soyuz MS-22 capsule which is currently docked at the ISS and had been due to bring the three crew members back to Earth in March.

entries.title: Five million children died before they turned 5 in 2021
entries.description: Nearly half of them were under a month old, and 1.9 million children were stillborn that year worldwide, according to two United Nations reports released Tuesday.

entries.title: Pension reform: What France's largest labor union has to say about it
entries.description: The CFDT, known for its moderate approach, has either supported or rejected different plans to reform the French pension system but has always opposed the idea of raising the legal retirement age.

entries.title: Facebook and Instagram ban ads targeted at teens based on gender
entries.description: Meta platforms say they will only use age and location to show ads to teens.

entries.title: UN says Washington border plan risks undermining basic human rights
entries.description: The Biden administration plans to expand Trump-era restrictions as record numbers of migrants cross the US-Mexico border.

entries.title: Pension reform: France faces an insurmountable divide
entries.description: France's labor unions are resolutely opposed to Emmanuel Macron's reform which will mainly impact those who started working early, in other words, the least qualified.

entries.title: Senegalese court grants temporary release for journalist Pape Alé Niang
entries.description: The Coordination of Press Associations wants the 'fantasy and political' charges against the prominent anti-government critic to be dropped.

entries.title: Fresh cyclone to hit California after historic storms
entries.description: A fresh storm was set to pound the state on Wednesday, January 12, with as much as 18 centimeters of new rain expected in northern California.

entries.title: Uganda declares end to latest Ebola outbreak
entries.description: Uganda has experienced several Ebola outbreaks, most recently in 2019 when at least five people died. The latest outbreak of this often fatal virus was first identified four months ago.

entries.title: Pension reform: French PM Borne vouches for 'fair' project
entries.description: Elisabeth Borne presented the French government's pension reform on Tuesday. It plans to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64, while allowing exceptions for long careers and raising the minimum pension.

entries.title: Offshore wind, solar installation and value sharing: The key issues in France's renewable energy bill
entries.description: MPs voted on Tuesday the legislation intended to accelerate the development of these energies in France, but several points are the subject of debate.

entries.title: Ukraine: Donbas town of Soledar taken by Russian forces, who are changing tactics
entries.description: The Wagner mercenary group has broken through Ukrainian defense lines and is about to give the Kremlin a small symbolic victory, but extremely costly in human lives.

entries.title: Pension reform: Main French unions call for major strike on January 19
entries.description: For the first time in 12 years, all the major trade unions have called for a joint demonstration for 'powerful long-term strikes and protests' to prevent any increase in the minimum retirement age.

entries.title: Peruvian president investigated after dozens killed in protests
entries.description: The government announced a curfew on Tuesday, January 10, in the southern Puno region in a bid to end violent protests.

entries.title: Germany's Lützerath: The village standing in the way of the last open-cast coal mine
entries.description: In this abandoned hamlet, which has become a symbol in the fight against climate change, activists want to block the advance of the last open-cast coal mine in the Rhine basin.

entries.title: Several lightly wounded in central Paris knife attack
entries.description: The attacker was quickly arrested after injuring several people, Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin wrote on Twitter.

entries.title: Cardinal George Pell dies aged 81
entries.description: The divisive Church leader died of heart complications related to a hip surgery he had undergone in a Rome hospital earlier this week.

entries.title: Wagner claims control of Ukraine's Soledar
entries.description: The extent of Wagner's control over the city was unclear on Wednesday, January 11. Seizing Soledar would be Russia's most substantial gain since August.

entries.title: India launches deep-sea mining project to develop the 'blue economy'
entries.description: Despite the inherent environment risks, New Delhi has launched the deep-sea mining initiative, valued at more than €460 million, with hopes of fulfilling its need for rare minerals.

entries.title: Extras from French film 'Father & Soldier' face deportation orders
entries.description: Oumar, Ousmane and Fodé arrived in France as minors, went to school, learned a trade and work. They are now supported by advocacy groups and company heads helping them stay in the country.

entries.title: The World Bank is concerned about global economic slowdown in 2023
entries.description: The Washington-based institution estimates that global growth is unlikely to exceed 1.7% in 2023. Underinvestment and food insecurity will continue to weaken the most vulnerable countries.

entries.title: In France, a law to accelerate renewable energies deployment is inadequate
entries.description: According to industrialists and NGOs, the provisions voted on are not expected to be enough to enable France to reach its climate objectives for 2050.

entries.title: French national Aurelien Michel charged in United States with NFT fraud
entries.description: The 24-year-old Breton, son of the former En Avant Guingamp footballer Claude Michel, has been arrested in New York. He has applied for bail after being accused of a €2.7 million scam.

entries.title: Golden Globes 2023: Steven Spielberg wins best director for 'The Fabelmans'
entries.description: After a two year hiatus, the Golden Globes are back with comedia Jerrod Carmichael as emcee.

entries.title: Biden 'surprised' to learn government records found in former office
entries.description: The US president, speaking to reporters in Mexico City, said he didn't know what is in the documents.

entries.title: Noel Le Graet calls for FFF executive committee meeting amidst controversy
entries.description: During the Wednesday meeting, the president of French football is expected to explain his controversial comments about Zidane and accusations of sexual harassment.

entries.title: United States: House Republicans launch inquiry into the 'weaponization' of government
entries.description: Democrats oppose the inquiry, calling it a partisan tool for Republicans to go after the Justice Department as Trump is the subject of several federal criminal investigations.
